snippet: Hurricane Sandy has cut off whole towns from basic information, supplies and electricity, leaving individuals who have lost everything increasingly desperate for help.
abstract: Patchy recovery from Hurricane Sandy exposes fractured region; some areas return to semblance of normal life, while others remain in dark, with little gasoline and growing complaints about slow pace of relief operations.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON, SAM DOLNICK and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taylor Adams, Ruth Bashinsky, Matt Flegenheimer, Elizabeth A. Harris, Angela Macropoulos, Ray Rivera, Liz Robbins, Marc Santora, Nate Schweber, Stacey Stowe and Bernard Vaughan.

lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy has cut off whole towns from basic information, supplies and electricity, leaving individuals who have lost everything increasingly desperate for help.

headline.seo: Fractured Recovery Nearly a Week After Hurricane Sandy
headline.print_headline: Fractured Recovery Divides a Frustrated Region
headline.sub:
Manhattan Improves
but Outlying Areas
Lack Basic Needs
